p: Choi et al. reported that, 3‐[{2‐((E)‐furan‐2‐ylmethylene) hydrazinyl}methylene]‐1,3‐dihydroindol‐2‐one (ATT‐5126) and 6‐trifluoromethyl‐2‐thiouracil (KH‐0562) showed higher selectivity index compared with Pyrimethamine (PYR) in treatment of toxoplasmosis (Choi et al., 2014). Also, Zhang et al. indicated that SI of Martine and Oxymartine parasite were higher compared with spiramycin in HeLa cells (Zhang et al., 2016). The present study demonstrates that the essential oil of D. kotschyi contains compounds possessing anti‐parasite properties. The presence of copaene, methyl geranate, geranial, carvone, 3‐carene, alpha‐pinene, limonene, and carveol compounds in these plants may be responsible for their anti‐parasitic effect on T. gondii infection. Traditionally, the plant has long been used for therapeutic purposes (Heydari et al., 2019).
